intro: Thottea aroangensis, commonly known as the Aroangensis thottea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from purple to pink. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream sides. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
